channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flooding at Lansdown Road crossing, YET AGAIN, 27th September
item.description:
Can only select one blocked gully on your map, but there are MANY. Heavy flooding (as of 7:45am today) at the pedestrian crossing on A40 Lansdown Road, close to junction with Shelburne Road, due to MULTIPLE BLOCKED GULLIES. Crossing is effectively unusable due to water halfway out into road carriageway. Pedestrians also at risk of a soaking as passing traffic drives through standing water. EVERY gully on BOTH SIDES of A40 from railway bridge through to Westal Green (Texaco filling station) need cleaning out - many are blocked and have been for YEARS despite repeated reporting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shelburne Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long stretch 3m stretch of damaged road surface, 27th September
item.description:
Pothole /damaged surface stretches from the roundabout with copt elm road towards the school. Damaged top layer has been there for some time, recent rainfall has made it worse. This toad is on a school route and damaged surface is now deep enough to dismount a child riding a bike.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lyefield Road East, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Several stretches of potholes and broken tarmac on Hayden Lane, 26th September
item.description:
Hayden Lane, west of Cheltenham. Several stretches of the road have potholes, some previously repaired several times and now opening up again. Also stretches of broken up tarmac toward the edges, which cars are now having to drive around to avoid damage, on a narrow lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 26th September
item.description:
You can see the weeds and leaves in the drain and there is a risk that these are close to blocking the drain. It is slow draining in heavy rainfall. This is the drain opposite the turning into Lavington Road outside 78/80.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lavington Drive, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This gully backs up during storms and floods surrounding houses, 26th September
item.description:
Gully outside 10 Wells Close. Likely a defect in sewer under drive to no.9
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Wells Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain College Road affecting St Luke's Road, 26th September
item.description:
The drain indicated on the map does not work so water flows into St Luke's Road (from College Rd) where it sits alongside the curb, unable to drain away into any of the drains in this part of St Luke's Road. It is often quite deep so not easy to access our cars without getting wet feet. Also, weeds and plants are growing happily as earth, leaves etc are also swept into the area. This is not the first time there has been a complaint. Although the Council sprayed weed killer this summer after I asked for them to remove all the growth, they did not return to remove all the plants so nothing has been achieved. This problem has been ongoing since the curved pavement on College Rd (opp A&E entrance) was built quite a few years ago. With the recent rain its been particularly bad.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, College Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain on the East side of Lansdown Parade appears blocked and causes significant flooding across the road and pavement., 26th September
item.description:
The drain opposite number 4 and 5 Lansdown Parade is blocked. This is an ongoing problem and has flooded the road on numerous occasions. This has been reported to Cheltenham Council previously and no action has been taken. The flooding creates significant risk for vehicles and is major hazard for pedestrians both of injuries from falling on flooded pavement as well as being soaked by spray from vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Lansdown Crescent, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wainlode Lane severely flooded at Cook Lane andbeyond, 26th September
item.description:
Third flood in last five days at Wainlode Lane/Cook Lane. Water level has not fallen since early morning and raining again now with more heavy rain forecast overnight. Flood water now only a few feet from my property

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Someone has dumped gas cans., 26th September
item.description:
Early this morning someone dumped gas bottles on the road. They are the type used for roofing. About 6 cans. My elderly neighbour who has dementia has been looking at them in the rain. They are on the grass now on the verge opposite my house.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jesson Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding leaving road impassable for cars, 26th September
item.description:
This road has basically been impassable for cars since Monday. It is not draining away at the junction of Wainlode Lane and Cook Lane. Every time it rains it tops up the water level.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding due to blocked drains, 26th September
item.description:
Flooding due to blocked drains at Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh. Blocked lane twice this week (Monday-Tuesday 23rd/24th September, and further flooding today, Thursday 26th September. Lane impassable and more rain forecast later today/overnight. Elderly residents and families with young children are affected. Drains damaged and/or blocked. Location outside The Croft, Blacksmith`s Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
